physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 20/25 vision in the right eye; only motion detection in the left eye; a left afferent pupillary defect; bitemporal hemianopia; swelling of the right optic disc; pallor of the left optic disc. No other cranial nerve deficits; otherwise normal neurologic examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Vision improved substantially to 20/30 and then 20/20 at 6-week follow-up; persistent deficit in the inferonasal quadrant of the left eye.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Lumbar puncture demonstrated glucose of 53 mg/dL, protein of 102.6 mg/dL, and 155 white blood cells/mL with 80% lymphocytes.
